website_summaries.verdict: A solid choice with plenty of positives.
pros: Durable gloves that protect the hands
Hands stay cooler than some competitors
Plenty of color and size choices
cons: Hands stay cool, but these could breathe a little better

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy to say they have held up well
customer_reviews.text: I was waiting to write this review, as I wanted to see how well these gloves would hold up over time. I'm happy to say they have held up well. I was especially concerned with whether they would develop an odor over time and the answer is NO! (I've been very careful to dry them well after using and spraying the inside with tea tree oil.) The gloves have great padding for protection and the wrist straps are very supportive. I was hesitant to spend this much money on a pair of gloves but I'm glad I did!
customer_reviews.author: Stevie1967

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit that I bought these for the looks. I loved the white on white. I did some research and thought these would be decent gloves. As soon as they came, I noticed how flimsy they were. There was little to no wrist support and the padding on the top of the glove was lacking. I returned them and got my money back. For the same price, you can get a decent pair of gloves with better wrist support and padding. I have been boxing for 3 years and I wouldn't recommend these to even a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney Lige

customer_reviews.title: Comfort, fit
customer_reviews.text: Love , love the bright pink color with the black! Gloves were comfortable the minute I put them on. No break in period required. I am 5’10”, 200 lbs. I have large hands-wear size 8 in women’s gloves so decided to go with 14 oz in these gloves and the fit is perfect. I also have arthritis in the thumb on the right hand and these gloves are so well padded that I don’t feel any discomfort when I hit the target. I definitely recommend these gloves!
customer_reviews.author: Amazoncustomers

customer_reviews.title: Super padded, beautiful af
customer_reviews.text: I get so many compliments on my gloves, it's insane. The guys and girls at my gym love them, and I really appreciate that it appeals to both genders. The color is so brightly neon that it actually glows against my face. Aside from its aesthetics, these gloves are also super padded and protect my hands very well. Overall, its performance and aesthetic designs render these gloves PERFECT AF.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Decent, 5'6 165lb 16oz fits fine with wraps
customer_reviews.text: 5'6, 165lb Gymnastic Built, bought the 16oz these runs a bit loose but it was fine after having the wraps on. And just like the pictures by others, it does give a bit more wrist flexion - prone to wrist injuries.
customer_reviews.author: JLong

customer_reviews.title: Okay a word on sizing...
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'6" 125-130 (woman) the chart says get a 12oz you definitely want the 14oz. These are also for lack of a better term aren't "juicy" on the bag at least in the 12oz. I hurt my knuckle using these and they feel paper thin. So... get the 14oz but I also wouldn't buy these again. They look cool as hell though.
customer_reviews.author: Murple

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$$
customer_reviews.text: Man after using everlast beginner gloves for sum years I was really surprised at the quality when I put these on. Almost felt like I was putting on a winter mitten. Slips on and off perfectly while also being tight to the the fit during training. The overall quality of the glove feels more professional and the padding feels different than a beginner glove in a better way. These gloves are also very soft on the inside and very stylish. I'm packin the 12oz gloves and these are way better than my everlast. No ones touching these gloves except me!
customer_reviews.author: Jolon

customer_reviews.title: Sharp looking, but a little bit puffy
customer_reviews.text: I compared them with some Fairtex gloves that I bought at the same time. While I do think the Venum look great, they didn't seem as durable as the Fairtex. I ultimately chose the Fairtex because I thought they would be better for sparring and light grappling because they are designed for more of a Muay Thai user. If you are planning to hit bags exclusively, and you like Venum's style, I say go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Edward M. Melendez

customer_reviews.title: Best Gloves out there
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and while I was in 2 minds because of the price tag, I went with it cuz I had hurt my wrists a bit too many times with my previous pair which were by century but those were given to me for free at my Kickboxing club so I couldn't really complain there but I got these and no more sprained wrists, I can throw as hard a punch as possible and I don't feel the pain in my wrists at all. Recommend these highly
customer_reviews.author: Laughing Coyote

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves; lacks a bit in the air-ventilation department
customer_reviews.text: The one gripe I have about these gloves is the hole isn't very large by the palm of the hand. I used to have a pair of Meisters for 2 years and I bought these to replace them. The Meister gloves allowed more ventilation. So if you prefer a lot of airflow, these aren't the best for it. Other than that, solid pair of gloves. Great wrist support.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Not super ventilation, but really attractive!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these gloves. They look incredible. I'm a 5'6"; 135lb woman, and the 14 oz fit great. The only reason I'm returning them is because I sweat like a maniac when I train, and the ventilation in these wasn't sufficient. I've been spoiled with gloves that have an entirely mesh palm. Within two minutes of putting these on, my hands were sweating--without wraps and just standing around my apartment. If that isn't an issue for you, then these are an incredible pair of gloves!
customer_reviews.author: Dearra Ginder

customer_reviews.title: Great fit. Not smelly. Solid durability.
customer_reviews.text: I started out using the basic Everlast gloves because pricing was decent and I wasn't looking for anything too fancy. After getting more into boxing, I started looking at different gloves and comparing prices vs utility. I came across Venum gloves since it had solid reviews and the design/color selections were luring. These gloves are more expensive but you'll forget how much these were once you start using them. The fit is very cushioned and comfortable. Throwing punches feel great with these on. Even after many sessions, I haven't run into any hygiene issues. Great fit. No smelly gloves. Solid durability. Done deal.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cho

customer_reviews.title: Wow. Best gloves ever !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Been doing kickboxing for over a year now. Had tried Everlast, Title and the Venum Challenger. None of the above were even close to these. Best padding system ever, I usually suffer from knuckles ache after workout but not with these. Pros: -best padding system for the price - not too big for the 16oz (challenger 16 are about 10% bigger) Cons: -limited space for the thumb. I’m 6’7” with rather large hands, fingers are fine. Thumb lacks space
customer_reviews.author: Mg

customer_reviews.title: Lasted two months
customer_reviews.text: The inside liner tore within two months of moderate use. I keep my finger nails trimmed and have never had this problem with other gloves. I would expect this from a $20 pair of gloves but not from a higher priced so called "elite" glove.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K

customer_reviews.title: Best Boxing Gloves to exist
customer_reviews.text: I was only browsing for boxing gloves just to decide if I wanted to buy some or not and then saw these Mexican Edition ones and they’re called Vemon gloves. I immediately dropped whatever I was doing (was feeding my baby), got my money and threw it at my phone. I HAVE NO REGRET buying it and they feel AMAZING. Real beautiful gloves and badass looking, so worth it. And as for my son, he’s fine, just some scratches but he doesn’t blame me, as soon as he saw the gloves, he forgave me and started gagaing.
customer_reviews.author: Father

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product!
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and durable. These work great! My only grip comes from user error/dependency (my own fault). Be diligent to not become dependent on the hand position or wrist support if you are practicing self defense. I noticed that I began leaving my thumb out in reality drills instead of making a proper fist. This is by no means the glove's responsibility but it is a word of advice.
customer_reviews.author: James Partsch Jr

customer_reviews.title: Poor ventilation, your hands WILL get really sweaty.
customer_reviews.text: I used to box, but now stick to heavy bags and such for cardio. I bought these after my Ringside gloves were done. These are my first pair of Venum boxing gloves and I find the hand protection/padding to be adequate. However, like other reviewers have mentioned these get really hot. Compared to every other brand I've used in the past these are poorly ventilated.
customer_reviews.author: Jon D.

customer_reviews.title: Look great, feels snug, good support,
customer_reviews.text: They gloves feel good on my hands and are a snug fit inside. I feel like there is enough cushion and padding in the gloves for me. I hit a heavy bag a couple days a week with them and they are perfect for a workout pair. Sometimes my fingers hurt though but I am a beginner. I need to flex the curve to stratighten out my fingers every now and then when I’m in the workout. Don’t know if this is just part of breaking in the gloves or my hands getting acclimated to being formed by the glove.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Ready for the KO when you are
customer_reviews.text: Novice boxer who decided to take a boxing fitness class. My first set of gloves felt tight the entire time. However, these feel like they are the perfect fit. They have enough padding that I’m comfortable getting into the punch and also comfortable when we are forced to ground for burpees and push ups. Others in my class have tried out my gloves and ordered a pair as well in various colors.
customer_reviews.author: SOWEGAReads

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars Boxing Gloves
customer_reviews.text: This Boxing/Kickboxing Gloves fit perfectly, it's NOT to heavy and humid like some of the other gloves brand that I have use in the past. This is the Best Boxing or Kickboxing Gloves that I've use for the last 10 years. And it protect the hand really well. I ONLY wish that the Velcro that wrap around the wrist was an inch or 2 inch longer : ) Other then that I highly highly recommend this Boxing/Kickboxing Gloves if you're looking for a High Quality and Amazing Boxing/Kickboxing Gloves for pads,Mitts,sparring, heavybag training.
customer_reviews.author: Nhan Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, good quality for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Amazon Warehouse sent me the wrong size - they sent me a 14 oz glove. Good job. These gloves are great, they hold up to strong strikes. Only used so far for 30 heavy bag sessions. Wish I had the 16 oz but the 14 works great too. They fit well - for reference, I wear an XL glove and for those in the medical field a size 8 or 8 1/2
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality, bad product support
customer_reviews.text: I've had the gloves for less than 3 months. I use them for cardio-related workouts 3 times a week. The stitches on the inside of the glove is coming apart. I contacted Venum directly, I was told the gloves have no warranty...How is that standing by your product? I previously had a cheaper brand ($20 was the cost) and they still work great. I purchased the Venum's because I wanted heavier gloves and I thought it would be an upgrade. Bad mistake. Don't buy it, they are not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Bosch

customer_reviews.title: After 32 uses: it broke inside the glove. Very Low Quality. Not safe! - Never heard from company!
customer_reviews.text: I've used the gloves twice a week and not every week. After 4 months the glove interior broke! The exterior of the glove is OK but with the interior broken and my fingers not being protected. I have to stop using them. I was surprised by the low durability and quality of the glove. I've never heard from the company. I won't ever buy this brand.
customer_reviews.author: PC79

customer_reviews.title: They fit... like a glove!
customer_reviews.text: Just unboxed and tried these on today (so I can't speak to durability), but they look gorgeous, fit comfortably, and seem to provide support. The craftsmanship is evident and the aesthetics are unmatched in gloves I've seen at the gym. Some reviewers have said these gloves are huge but I disagree - the pair I received are comparable to other gloves I've seen and tried on. For reference, I'm 6'1 and 175 lbs and bought the 16 oz. I have large hands that just fit perfectly in these gloves. I'm upgrading from a pair of Everlast that I'll keep around as bag gloves, but the Venum definitely have more padding and wrist support.
customer_reviews.author: E. Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves
customer_reviews.text: My son uses these gloves for amateur boxing. This is his second pair of Venums. The first pair (slightly heavier and black) lasted a long time. When they finally wore out, he wanted a lighter pair so he went down to the 12 ounce weight. The white color is a nice switch up since most people use black. Worth the money, durable and long lasting.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie R.

customer_reviews.title: Low quality stitching
customer_reviews.text: The stitching on the inside of the glove where my index and middle fingers go into started coming apart a couple months into using them. I would recommend spending a little more and getting some better quality gloves.
customer_reviews.author: M. Grant

customer_reviews.title: They are also comfortable and looks durable that will last for a long ...
customer_reviews.text: These are well made gloves. They are also comfortable and looks durable that will last for a long time. I am around 180 pounds and my right hand circumference is 7.8 inches to be exact. Took the advice of the size chart and got myself the 14 ounce gloves. Found that it was a little room on the inside of the gloves for my finger to wiggle about (since my hands are somewhat regular/mid size). It is not exactly a snug fit. Guess may have to wear thick hand warps during workouts on the heavy bag.
customer_reviews.author: Ham

customer_reviews.title: Not as much cushion as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I had some 12 and 14 oz everlast gloves. I have worn the 14 oz out and wanted some gloves with more padding. I ordered the 16 oz version of these. These 16oz are not as protective as either my 14 or 12 everlasts in terms of direct hits. However, they are longer and provide a lot more wrist support than the everlast versions. They do appear to be of great quality. I just was expecting an upgrade to knuckle protection to be more than what I already had.
customer_reviews.author: Peanuts

customer_reviews.title: Not very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: The gloves were great for about 2 months. After that they got really loose, smelly and uncomfortable. In fact they actually hurt when you hit the heavy bag. I've never purchased boxing gloves before, so I'm not sure if this is typical for gloves in this price range, and I don't have any other recommendations. But it's disconcerting that a pair of $70 dollar gloves would have such poor durability. I unfortunately cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Hands were hurting
customer_reviews.text: I had to return these. I was having problems were my hand all of a sudden started hurting when i was sparring with my trainer. I realized it was since i changed to these gloves. I returned them immediately and bought replacements of my old gloves and my hand is fine now.
customer_reviews.author: kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been in kickboxing for 6 plus years and have used other brands of gloves. The venum elite are far superior to other brands that I have used. 1. No real break in period 2. Mold to hand perfectly. (Giving perfect form) 3. Mesh on inside of palm (better breathing) 4 padded palms. 5, soft leather with great graphics. 6. Great padding. I showed my coach and he said that he will start selling them through his gym. He currently had another brand and is moving forward with venum.
customer_reviews.author: cacloser

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable But Hot
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing these awhile now. I love them more than the standard boxing gloves I have. I use them for fitness kickboxing and needed a heavier weight and more padding. They provide all that except that it gets really hot and sweaty in there, the gloves have ventilation holes, but I don't think they provide enough ventilation. Still worth for the price though.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie E.

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves, they arrived quicker than expected as always when purchasing from amazon. I used them today for the first time, both on a heavy bag and for sparring.... love them! They are super comfortable, and fit really well even with 4metre wraps underneath. And the Matt black looks amazing. I'd definitely recommend at this stage, will see how they hold up after some good use.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Huggins

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, but awkward wrist positioning
customer_reviews.text: Great looking glove, feels well made but wrist area seems to curve the wrist into a bent position (light flexion) which makes you feel like you have to work to keep the wrist straight and aligned. After using the gloves once I wound up having to ice my elbow at the lateral epicondyle area which was throbbing from the weird position. I am really bummed as I like the look and feel of the gloves. My next step is to tape up my wrists to see if it stops the problem. If not, they will have to go back. 😰
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Joy Smith-vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Used
customer_reviews.text: I found black marker marks on the glove meaning I bought used gloves thinking I bought them new. I like the way the gloves fit inside. With the air circulation holes it keeps my hands from getting sweaty so I don’t have to stop and take my hands out of the gloves.
customer_reviews.author: tally

customer_reviews.title: Perfect glove!
customer_reviews.text: I loveeeeeeeee my gloves! After some time of use now, at least 3 or 4 days weekly, they look like I just bought them! The fit it great, amazing padding, vibrant color, all the details are perfect. I would recommend these to anyone. I use these mostly hitting bags and a handful of times sparing they are great for both uses. I can't say enough good things about the quality of these gloves and the fit!
customer_reviews.author: Cierra Bolton

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: I used to have cheaper Venum gloves and liked it, but since then I have used different gloves. My last one didn't have good wrist support, so I got these ones. I like the fact they keep my wrist straight. I got 12oz. I am happy so far. I only use them 3-4 times a week punching heavy bags, so they should last me for a while...
customer_reviews.author: h a

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I just got into boxing 4 months ago and initially got a cheap pair of $15 starter gloves to mess around with. Surprising they're good but I needed an upgrade and decided to get the 16 oz Venum gloves and I love them. They are far superior in quality, comfort and overall feel. Fantastic for hitting the heavy bag or just light sparring, Really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dre

customer_reviews.title: VERY Solid Overall Boxing Glove Selection
customer_reviews.text: Super great gear and I have gotten compliments on them multiple times. Use these for mittwork, sparring, heavy bag work. Decided on 14 oz for best balance of power and was surprised by the comfort and the fist/wrist support they allow without becoming restricting. Very durable and a step up when comparing my old Everlast pair. No freying so far after 2 months which is commonly the first issue and no cracking of leather (and I hit hard asf) after 2 months of heavy bag use once a week.
customer_reviews.author: Random dude

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are amazing! They fit very nice especially with my quick ...
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are amazing! They fit very nice especially with my quick wraps on. Can't feel a thing when hitting a heavy bag or sparring. I definitely recommend these gloves as a great Buy. Would definitely recommend these gloves to anyone especially everyone that goes to my gym
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend recently took up boxing. Our friends have the Venom Challenger gloves and highly recommended the Venom brand. I initially bought the black Venom Elite gloves. They were nice, but I'm so happy I switched them out for these khaki ones. The khaki is a nice green and makes the gloves stand out. My boyfriend has gotten so many compliments on this glove! He says they are also very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gloves
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these several times a week for the last 2.5 months and they've served me very well. They are easy to clean and people are always complimenting them because they look so stylish. These gloves have substance, though, as my hand has been extremely well-protected with every use, whether I'm boxing or hitting bags. The gray color is pretty sexy, though.
customer_reviews.author: Elys

customer_reviews.title: Great intermediate gloves
customer_reviews.text: I got the 16oz gloves for light sparring in training. They feel well made and look pretty fly. They have held up well after at least a few months of training. and even survived my dog chewing on them. I would say that I don't particularly like how I have to manually make a fist instead of the glove naturally putting my hands in that position. I am planing on getting a different pair of gloves for sparring/comp and these will probably become my new bag gloves. overall very good product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: James Banes

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, lightweight pair of gloves
customer_reviews.text: I used to only use Title World Gel Bag Gloves, and while the advertised weight per Title Gel Bag glove is about 16 oz each individual glove probably weighs at least 24 oz. That's at least three total pounds of glove. I put these 10oz Venum Elite gloves on and it was like I had new arms, and shoulders, and chest, and legs, and whole body. Punches are so much faster and more crisp. For a 10oz glove there is a lot of padding around the knuckles and fingers to protect from boxer's fractures and if your hand is a normal size there is room for a wrist wrap underneath, which protects the wrists. Great overall product.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Decent.
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion these are a step above the Everlast Pro gloves. They are similar in design, fit, and padding. They may even be manufactured by the same company. They are good for workouts on the light, medium, and reflex bags. I would not recommend their use on the heavy bag. I get better protection for heavy bag workouts with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wynieski

customer_reviews.title: Great overall, a bit bulky.
customer_reviews.text: These are great gloves, they do run a bit bulkier (thicker on the fist) so get a 2 oz. size smaller if that's a concern, otherwise you can just adapt to the extra thickness, which is fine too. Standard size would be 10 oz. or 12 oz. Great quality, great fist protection, great value, and great ventilation even though the hand does not have a mesh style.
customer_reviews.author: ian

customer_reviews.title: Love the gloves, but...
customer_reviews.text: I box 5 times a week and I love these gloves, what a difference compared to what I had. It's like having pillows on my hands. BUT, for $80, they should have come in their own cloth bag/case, not some cheap plastic bag that is going to end up in the ocean even after I recycle it. Really Venum...?
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: A great fit for people with long fingers
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a glove that would fit my hands, and they do a pretty good job as I have long fingers and a narrow hand. In other gloves, my thumb would be uncomfortably pressed against the end of the thumb. That's not the case with these gloves as there is plenty of room. There is a little bit of play across the knuckles, but a couple extra turns of my wrist wrap make it fit well
customer_reviews.author: Typical Dad

customer_reviews.title: Best gloves I had so far
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my elites for about 5 months now and they are holding up better than what I hoped for. The material is durable I don't do any thing out the way from my normal routine and they are great. They are lighter than usual gloves I normally use and twice as comfortable. I've used them almost everyday for the last 5 months and I have had no issues. I recommend these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Jazmine

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT!! I beat the sh*t out of my bag in fight camp and I don't feel a thing but the exhilaration of all my anger and hate dissipating from my body. I also love the bright neon color so I don't forget them in gym. Well made with leather, not the weird cancerous materials out there.
customer_reviews.author: franchesca2bqq

customer_reviews.title: Cheap & Ugly
customer_reviews.text: I bought the black and gold ones because that color combo looked so sharp on amazon, however in real life the fake leather these gloves are made of is really dull and matte so the black appears as dark grey and gold as beige, the type of colors you find in a nursing home. Venum, for $75 you need to make a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Skuli Magnusson

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy hitters.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the gloves to replace my previous pair of leather gloves, expecting higher quality as they cost much more. The fit was so strange, but I wanted to try them anyway. One workout and I broke the foam at the end of the gloves. Never used them again.
customer_reviews.author: M847837

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Glove Until The Stitching Goes
customer_reviews.text: These gloves were fantastic until today when I noticed a hole on the inside of the right hand glove. It feels like the stitching gave way and I'm pretty sure I can feel the glove padding/stuffing. Purchased in December, used 3 times a week since January 3. For such little use i feel like these should have held up much longer. Waiting to speak with customer service before returning to review further.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon F.

customer_reviews.title: Top quality a gloves, worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Top quality a gloves, worth every penny! I used to be a big Ringside fan but noticed that within a few months, my gloves would be worn out; these gloves far exceed those. Long story short, these are great and I doubt that you will find a better pair.
customer_reviews.author: Osvaldo Acevedo

customer_reviews.title: Could cause injury, not comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 16 oz gloves for sparring, not sure if it’s a common problem but the thumbs of the gloves were pressed extremely tight and cause A friction injury whenever I use these. Padding is also very stiff and overall the leather is not very high quality. Surprised they are rated so highly because after 7-8 wears I am ready to throw them away. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Arjun

customer_reviews.title: Great padding, poor lining structure
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these gloves in september and have consistently used them about 3x a week for bag work. The padding is great and is solid protection but the inner lining of the glove near the fingertips recently tore and it's nearly impossible to get in to fix it. They're a great pair of gloves, I only wish they were more durable.
customer_reviews.author: ocean wong

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought some cheap gloves when I first started boxing because I was not sure I would stick with it. Soon I got a lot of pain in my wrist and down my forearm so I invested in these. They are amazing! I now box 5x a day and have been doing so for 3 months and these hold up great! Would recommend wiping them down with essential oil mixed with alcohol every so often for the smell and longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Maya

customer_reviews.title: Solid and well-made
customer_reviews.text: I've been boxing for many years now, and gone through a few pairs of gloves from other big name brands. They get shredded over time, both inside and out. So far these seem MUCH nicer quality, and feel very well made. I'm extremely happy with them and will buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: brooklynfan

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves
customer_reviews.text: Very nice gloves. I use them on a heavy bag and double end bag. They hold up well even with very frequent use.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves. I did some boxing long time ago ...
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves. I did some boxing long time ago and now I want to do kickboxing just to train mainly for cardio i decided to get these Venum Elite to work on bag. They are very comfy to put my hands in even with wraps. The build is solid and material is amazing. For now I give them 5 stars but I'll see if they can still do good after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Lam Tran

customer_reviews.title: Cleto Reyes vs. Venum | I"m spoiled, I know
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are perfect for beginners. They feel good and contour my grip fairly well. But I also own a pair of Cleto Reyes 16 oz. gloves. They are 2 years old and I swear, still in perfect condition. They fit perfectly. When I put on the Venum gloves, I wasn't able to clinch my fist as I am with Reyes. These are perfect for beginners because they really protect the knuckles well. The loop strap seem stable and strong. I'd recommend this to anyone starting out. Definite contender.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A. Mulligan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice. Fit nice. Well made
customer_reviews.text: Excellent gloves. Fit as expected. Nicely made...not cheap. Even my trainer loves them and said he wouldn't mind trying them out sometime.
customer_reviews.author: kjs

customer_reviews.title: BEST GLOVES
customer_reviews.text: BEST gloves I've ever had. Very good material and great feel on the bag. You can use them for bag, sparring everything. Awesome product, I love it. If you buy the right size and go light on sparring or bag, they fit you o good , don't even need wraps.
customer_reviews.author: Oleh

customer_reviews.title: The BEST! Gloves hands down ( :) )
customer_reviews.text: These are the best purchase I've made, for my boxing exercise program. I highly recommend these gloves. They hold up better than several other pairs I have, dont slip and the construction and quality are amazing!
customer_reviews.author: sonjarenee2001

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves for the price, I've been muay thai style kick boxing for a while and had these gloves for the last 4 months and love the fact that when I hit hard I can feel the impact but that being said with these gloves you might want to build up your hands and wrists a little before you start full strength bangin on some hand mitts or harder pads, got a little string sticking out from the stitching on the palm side on the outside of the right glove
customer_reviews.author: Anna&Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Super sleek and durable
customer_reviews.text: Bought these gloves after retiring my Title gloves. Been boxing for 3 years now. They are great and look amazing. However my hand does not seem to fit it properly. Never had that feeling when I put on a pair of gloves. I am still breaking them in and hope they loosen up a bit on the inside. I do love them and will continue using them until they are fully broken in.
customer_reviews.author: Lilian

customer_reviews.title: Amazing gloves - look and feel
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are outstanding. Look and feel amazing. Plenty of support. They are so nice I don't set them on the floor. I use them and so do my 20 year old sons.
customer_reviews.author: CeoSomeDay

customer_reviews.title: Sprained my wrist with these
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews but I feel compelled to after ordering these. I’ve taken many boxing classes using rented gloves, with no problem, and then I bought these since I was boxing enough to own my own gloves. I sprained my wrist the third time I used these gloves. Really upsetting, no support and honestly dangerous if you like to hit hard. Do not order
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for advanced fighters
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of these gloves. I like them because they are easy to take on and off with wraps on. Also, they are comfortable and have good padding for hard punches. If you are not a hard hitter and are a beginner, a less pricey and lighter glove might serve you better. However, if you a committed hard hitting advanced fighter, these are the gloves for you. I highly recommend the 16 oz with a 180 wrap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More Than I Expected
customer_reviews.text: Damn! These things are amazing! I also have a pair of their Venum Contender but these Elite are a whole 'nother animal. I trained with them yesterday and everything about them felt good. My hand felt like a hot knife through butter when I slid them off and the padding is really good. Match these up with some Mexican hand-wraps and you have yourself a great combo.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Calderon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wife loved these. And now she looks even better when hitting the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Palasiewicz

customer_reviews.title: great quality
customer_reviews.text: my other gloves always fall apart easily or get holes in them. these have held up nicely and i love the way they look.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these gloves but I can't. My left thumb went through some pain from rubbing on something inside the glove - I developed a callus on it after a couple weeks of pain, so it's fine now (not ideal). The gloves seem to be slightly different sizes, so they are inconsistent quality. I received used and wrong color gloves at first and can definitely feel a difference in sizes in them. Nice gloves, but I'm not satisfied with them.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Hamway

customer_reviews.title: Not the most comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I really like these boxing gloves but it interferes with the grip around my pinky finger. I have to use a lot of tape in that area to make it feel less uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: vmr

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality, very happy customer
customer_reviews.text: These things are very comfortable. I feel like I could wear them all day. They look and feel like very good quality inside and out. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J287B153

customer_reviews.title: Good Glove
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for a little over a month now and they are holding up really well. I kickbox 3-4 times/week. I'm 5'9, 200 lbs and the gloves fit nicely with wrapped hands. The leather is really nice and the glove looks really sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: 4 years of active use and going
customer_reviews.text: I started with these as a beginner 4 years ago and I kickbox 3-5 times a week in these since. They protect my wrists and hands very well, are easy to maintain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners but pricey for the quality
customer_reviews.text: They fit well at first and had good wrist support. They felt a little bulkier than I would’ve liked though. After about 3 weeks the foam inside the glove split from the area that it was stitched to at the wrist. This has basically ruined any wrist support that I had gotten with the gloves. To be fair I like to throw really hard hooks and have been boxing for a few years now so they might be fine for beginners. But I would say it’s too pricey to be a beginners glove.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Good padding, nice design
customer_reviews.text: Good quality glove. Good padding for your knuckles when hitting a heavy bag. My hands do get pretty sweaty inside the gloves which is unfortunate. And I don't usually have sweaty hands. But I wear wraps underneath so it's assumed your hands will sweat somewhat.
customer_reviews.author: tots

customer_reviews.title: Great cushion and comfort
customer_reviews.text: As a beginner, the comfort of the gloves is helping me gain confidence. An added plus is that I have gotten many compliment on the look - bad ass for an old lady!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Zelda

customer_reviews.title: Review from a beginner
customer_reviews.text: So this was my first set of boxing gloves ever. Initially they felt great (and still do really) but after trying on some more expensive models I see why these are priced as they are. They are a great value for the investment and I would recommend to anyone just getting into it. I don't see a need for beginners to have any of the upgraded/ more expensive models.
customer_reviews.author: jp

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, breathable, and looks really good.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a professional boxer or anything, but I've taken some personal training sessions for just over a year now. I'm really happy with the look of the gloves and the comfortability of the gloves. Additionally, Nothing has peeled yet (I've had these for two months) and I haven't seen any other reviews about the gloves peeling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality gloves, reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of these gloves are good. Definitely better than those cheap Everlast gloves. There's enough cushion in these Venum gloves that you won't feel much of the Impact when hitting the bag. Spend a bit more and get these instead of cheap Everlast.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin

customer_reviews.title: So far so good! I returned some Everlast gloves before buying these ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I returned some Everlast gloves before buying these because my fingers kept hitting the end of the glove - these have a lot more room. I'm really happy with my purchase, hoping they hold up
customer_reviews.author: Tami D

customer_reviews.title: Quality gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality product. I’m completely new to fighting so take this review with a grain of salt, however I must say that these gloves have exceeded my expectations by far. Right out of the box the gloves looked and felt amazing, but they didn’t stop there, I went out and started hitting my bag and I immediately felt the difference in quality from the old hand me downs I had been using prior. Love these gloves, will be buying more for my family.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Gardea

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable and hurts
customer_reviews.text: This glove is very low quality, the compensate by having cool asethetics. Has very unnatural fit within glove where you can fully close your hand, in addition the top of the glove is rounded which doesn’t let your punches land flush and twists your wrist causes pain on every punch, highly un recommend
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTIAN LAGERLING

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable right out of the bag!
customer_reviews.text: Use these for kickboxing workout gym. Very comfortable and feel great. Have had them quite a few months and no significant wear or premature tearing. Also bought glove inserts to keep them dry and from getting smelly and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Simms

customer_reviews.title: Going strong after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Really a big fan of these gloves. They've been very durable and continue to go strong after 6 months, plus I just love the look of matte black. Got the 16oz ones but I've used the 12 oz before and liked those as well.
customer_reviews.author: Gsal

customer_reviews.title: A bit pricy but worth the buck
customer_reviews.text: There are cheaper decent Venum gloves for beginners but I love how comfortable this feels. Nice cushion, generally soft padding and Venum always has cool design
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Good quality gloves
customer_reviews.text: I love boxing and love this brand, but i don't understand why i did not receive the normal bag to put the gloves away, i got them wrapped in plastic. For the price of the product and to not get the gloves ruined i don't know why i got them like that, and i have bought venum gloves before. Besides that, amazing gloves and great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Clementine M.

customer_reviews.title: Good for me
customer_reviews.text: i don't know why they compare, they are all right. I believe there are other models I need to check to decide what is best
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality!I was boxing everyday for 3-4months, now down to 1-2x a week but still happy with this purchase. They look great and feel comfortable. The only downside some people may see is if your wrist is very small, which mine is, then the wrist strap may not get tight enough around but you could always wrap up more times under it to fill the gap. Hasn't bothered me but I also do not compete.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Hazen

customer_reviews.title: Hands Hurt
customer_reviews.text: $20 ones i had for two years now I are better than this, this one just looks nice but my hand hurts only after 2 secsions.
customer_reviews.author: SWAT

customer_reviews.title: Love em. Loud and proud baby
customer_reviews.text: Love em. Loud and proud baby, Venum is quickly becoming my favorite brand of boxing glove. Again, the one flaw with all Venum gloves is that they're a little tight on the inside if you've got large hands but whatever, you'll break em in.
customer_reviews.author: Phillyboyy

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to buy such expensive boxing gloves. I’d say these are 100% worth the cost. The 16oz version is a must. They’re comfortable, durable and look really cool too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sizing seems to be way off.
customer_reviews.text: I got these in and they seemed like good quality but they were so big I couldn't even use them. I went by the sizing chart and they were at least two sizes too big... I guess I have small hands or something? All the more reason not to make a sizing chart for gloves that goes by height and weight.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Something to be made aware of...
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the product as it "interacts" very well with my punching bag and totally satisfies my needs. The problem one needs to be made aware of is the fact that the Amazon delivery too frequently made at the wrong address (to the displeasure of neighbors!)
customer_reviews.author: F. Montagnier

customer_reviews.title: quality gloves that hold up to a beating.
customer_reviews.text: Very strong and solid gloves. Look great and felt great on my hands. I have thin hands with long fingers and small wrists and they fit perfect. Only complaint is the distribution of padding, with there was more focused on the strike zone.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Built to last!
customer_reviews.text: Had them for a few months now and use them 3-5 times a week. They are comfy and have held up amazing with no rips or tears. Worth the extra $$. Buy a deodoraizer for them to keep them smelling good!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and durable
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves. I don’t get in the ring anymore but they’re great for training and doing some exercises on the bag
customer_reviews.author: D.Kalivas

product_meta.title: Venum Elite Boxing Gloves
product_meta.description: So our "Elite" boxing gloves was fully handmade in Thailand with a 100% Skintex leather conception in order to bring you the highest fighting experience at the best price. We used triple density foam for an unbelievable balanced shock distribution: fight after fight, you will be able to increase your striking level while minimizing the stressful sensation at the impact areas.
feature_bullets: Fully assembled and hand-stitched in Thailand

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
